Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a buff-coloured pottery slightly ribbed vessel, the fabric contains a number of large grey inclusions, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of red-painted Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394267) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394267)
